intro: Weinmannia paitensis, commonly known as the Paita weinmannia, is a flowering plant species native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in humid, mountainous environments, often in cloud forests. Its leaves are usually leathery and elliptical, with a glossy surface. The flowers are small and white or pale pink, arranged in dense, terminal clusters.
